chapter.title: Upgrade from Previous Versions of JBoss Developer Studio

section.title: Upgrade Methods
section.para: The method for upgrading JBoss Developer Studio depends on whether you are using JBoss Developer Studio or JBoss Developer Studio BYOE.

warning.para: Before upgrading, you are advised to back up your workspace. In addition to your project files, your workspace contains meta-data about customized setting and preferences for JBoss Developer Studio or Eclipse. To back up your workspace, either copy the workspace directory to a backup location or save it as a compressed file.

section.title: Upgrade JBoss Developer Studio
section.para: It is not possible to upgrade an existing JBoss Developer Studio installation to JBoss Developer Studio 7 because they are based on different versions of Eclipse. For example, JBoss Developer Studio 6 is based on Eclipse Juno (4.2) but JBoss Developer Studio 7 is based on Eclipse Kepler (4.3).
To use JBoss Developer Studio 7, you must download and run the universal installer available from the Customer Portal at .

note.para: You can use different versions of JBoss Developer Studio alongside each other by installing them in different directories.

section.title: Upgrade JBoss Developer Studio BYOE
section.para: It is not possible to upgrade an existing JBoss Developer Studio BYOE to JBoss Developer Studio 7 BYOE because they support different versions of Eclipse. For example, JBoss Developer Studio 6 BYOE supports Eclipse Juno but JBoss Developer Studio 7 BYOE supports Eclipse Kepler.
To use JBoss Developer Studio 7 BYOE, you must upgrade to Eclipse Kepler and install JBoss Developer Studio 7 BYOE from Eclipse Marketplace.
